column4: Is there usually a lot of trouble with things breaking upon new distro releases?
you have a support question or just want to chat
Im just curious
not in packages.ubuntu.com ?
deborphan?
Is deborphan generally pretty safe? I've heard stories of it removing packages that people needed
safe? this is linux ;]
aye
How do I play with the settings?

Sorry to be so inept, but does it allow per application volume-control.. etc? Because I'm under sound preferences and it looks the exact same as it did in Gutsy. I don't see any added features? Maybe I'm in the wrong place? System>Pref>Sound?
let me look hang on a sec
Any luck?
did that not do it?
right click and add to panel

I'm confused, did you say something before hand? What am I adding to panel? I have a volume control already. I thought Pulse-audio allowed for per application volume control, etc? Or did I misunderstand?
oops wrong nick sorry
for a lot of stuff the prefs work; but for individual apps it might be a bug that overrides the setting
Pulse audio is new to Hardy though, correct? Shouldn't there be some new settings under my Sound Preferences? Because it looks the same as it did in Gutsy.
I set the top to alsa and left the rest alone--you can try to set them on various levels --some bugs to work out as this is still pretty new
you should see the launchpad page ;]
err pages I mean ;]
